metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Any changes you do with the application locally, on your own computer, is not visible on the deployed version.
content.html: Any changes you do with the application locally, on your own computer, is not visible on the deployed version.

content.text: So if you make a change, and you want it to be visible on the deployed version, you have to upload a new .zip file.
content.html: So if you make a change, and you want it to be visible on the deployed version, you have to upload a new .zip file.

content.text: To wrap your project into a .zip file, follow the steps described in the Create .zip File chapter:
content.html: To wrap your project into a .zip file, follow the steps described in the Create .zip File chapter:

content.text: Start by selecting the relevant files and folders of your project, if you have the same project as we have in our tutorial, you should select the highlighted files in the example below:
content.html: Start by selecting the relevant files and folders of your project, if you have the same project as we have in our tutorial, you should select the highlighted files in the example below:

content.code_html:
my_tennis_club
    .ebextensions/
    members/
    my_tennis_club/
    mystaticfiles/
    productionfiles/
    db.sqlite3
    manage.py
    requirements.txt

content.text: Right-click and choose to create a .zip file.
content.html: Right-click and choose to create a .zip file.

content.text: Now you have a .zip file, containing the changes, and you can upload it to Elastic beanstalk:
content.html: Now you have a .zip file, containing the changes, and you can upload it to Elastic beanstalk:

content.code:
my_tennis_club

.ebextensions/

members/

my_tennis_club/

mystaticfiles/

productionfiles/

db.sqlite3

manage.py


requirements.txt
content.code_html:
my_tennis_club
    .ebextensions/
    members/
    my_tennis_club/
    mystaticfiles/
    productionfiles/
    db.sqlite3
    manage.py
    my_tennis_clup.zip
    requirements.txt

content.text: Log into your Amazon Web Services account, and find your project under the "Elastic Beanstalk" application:
content.html: Log into your Amazon Web Services account, and find your project under the "Elastic Beanstalk" application:

content.text: Click the "Choose file" button to upload the .zip file you just created:
content.html: Click the "Choose file" button to upload the .zip file you just created:

content.text: That's it, your project is updated with all the new changes.
content.html: That's it, your project is updated with all the new changes.

content.text: Note: Follow these steps every time you want to update your project.
content.html: Note: Follow these steps every time you want to update your project.
